humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle bones, bronze inscriptions, and small seals from " wood " from "å›—", wood in the "å›—", "å›—" is also a sound symbol. " Thrown " is the first article of "æ¢±" and "æ˜ƒ". Duan Yucai annotated the word "æ¢±" and said: "It is said that there is a wooden door in the door." Yu Yue: "The sleepy person, the ancient prose of Yang." ": "Bang, door prongs. From the wood, the sound of sleepy." Being sleepy is from the wood, and from the wood, it is unreasonable. After the cover is written, the ancient characters stop being sleepy. Those who follow the door are surrounded by the door. , The upper is the frieze, the lower is the lintel, the left and the right are the roots, among which the wood is the so-called æ©œye." The original meaning of " sleepy " is the threshold. This meaning leads to the meaning of hindrance. "Zhou Yi. "Stupid": "Stuck in the stone, based on the tribulus." That is, the rock obstructs the way forward, and the tribulus occupy it. The meaning of hindrance and restriction is extended to being in a difficult and difficult situation. "Historical Records. "The Biography of Qu Yuan Jiasheng": "Qi was so angry that he couldn't save Chu, and Chu was very troubled." It means that because Qi State hated Chu State's treachery and refused to send troops to rescue him, Chu State was in a very difficult situation. Later it was extended to the meaning of encirclement, namely siege. Zhuge Liang (Later Departure Table): "He used troops as if Sun and Wu were trapped in Nanyang." It means that Cao Cao used soldiers like Sun Bin and Wuqi, but he was besieged in Nanyang. Later, the word " sleepy " was interpreted as exhaustion. Tang Bai Juyi, "Sai Tan Weng": "The days of hunger for the cows are high, and people rest in the mud outside the south gate of the city." The cows are tired, and Tan Weng is hungry, so they rest outside the city gate to the south of the market. After " sleepy ", because there are too many meanings under the guise, the symbol " wood " is added and the word "æ¢±" is added; or the symbol " door " is added and the word "é˜ƒ" is added to express the original meaning (Yu Yue, Yang Shuda).

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the sacrificial name (Guo Moruo), "Compilation": "It's trapped in Shangjia, rain?" "Shangjia" is the ancestor of the Yin people; the inscriptions point to Shangjia for rituals. Will it rain?

The meaning of the inscription is unknown, and it is suspected to be an official title. Father Ding Kunjue: "Father Ding Kunjue."

The Qin bamboo slips are used as the original meaning, that is, "é˜ƒ", "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. Japanese Book A Type "Jan 2 3: "Walk to Bangmen (é˜ƒ)." "Men" is the threshold erected in the middle of the door. It is also interpreted as a person in difficulty, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Jian. "The Way of the Officials" Jane 3: "Widows and Orphans in Poverty." That is, orphans, widows, people in poverty and hardship.

Chu Jian explained it to the extreme. "Shangbo Chu Zhushu Seven. "Fan Logistics Form A" Jan. 24: "Aware of danger and difficulty, and recovery of difficulty." It means that when you know the danger, you know the limit, and you know the limit and you turn back.

Han silk script is used as the meaning of siege. "Mawangdui Silk Book. "The Warring States Strategist Book" line 263: "I trapped the soldiers of Qin and Han to avoid the troubles of Chu and Chu." The word "Chu" is repeated; it means I (Chen Zhen) besieged both Qin and Han The army, get rid of the scourge of Chu.

"Shuowen": "The old house is sleepy. From the wood is in the middle." "The old house" is the old house.
